author: Special Correspondent
text:
V. Panneerselvam, MP, has urged the Railway Minister to take steps for the introduction of a day-time train from Salem to Chennai with immediate effect.

A day-time train connecting these important cities is a long pending demand, he said while speaking on the Railway Budget in the Lok Sabha recently.

He said that he had already placed this demand in Parliament on various occasions in the past and the Railway Minister assured to fulfil the demand. But there is no announcement on this train in the budget, he said.

Mr. Panneerselvam said that the Chief Minister had stated that the State Government had prioritised three projects for implementation through SPV with the joint participation of the Railways: Chennai – Thoothukudi freight corridor; Chennai-Madurai-Kanyakumari and Madurai – Coimbatore High Speed Passenger Rail links.

While commending the Railway Ministry for the announcement regarding setting up of the first ever Rail-Auto Hubat Chennai, Mr. Panneerselvam demanded more attention in the implementation of railway projects in the fast developing two-tier cities such as Coimbatore, Madurai, Tiruchi, Tirunelveli, Tirupur, Erode, Salem, Vellore, Thanjavur and Thoothukudi.
title: MP seeks day-time train between Salem-Chennai
